document.masterDocTitle: Checklist of the Red Sea Fishes with delineation of the Gulf of Suez, Gulf of Aqaba, endemism and Lessepsian migrants

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Checklist of the Red Sea Fishes with delineation of the Gulf of Suez, Gulf of Aqaba, endemism and Lessepsian migrants

subSubSection.paragraph:
Gulf of Suez :
¯

Gulf of Aqaba: Egypt (
Nemtzov et al . 1987
; McCosker & Randall 2001 ), Jordan ( Debelius 2007 ).

Red Sea main basin:
¯
General distribution: Red Sea, Indo-West Pacific: East Africa east to southern Japan , Philippines and New Guinea .

Gulf of Suez :
¯

Gulf of Aqaba :
¯

Red Sea main basin: Egypt (
Klunzinger 1871, as
Ophichthys melanotaenia
).
General distribution: Red Sea , Indo-West Pacific: East Africa east to Hawaiian and Austral islands.

Gulf of Suez :
¯
Gulf of Aqaba: Egypt ( Lieske & Myers 2010 ), ( Jordan ( Khalaf 2004 ).
Red Sea main basin: Egypt ( Klausewitz 1969a ).

General distribution:
Red Sea , Indo-West Pacific: East Africa east to Society and
Marquesas islands .

Gulf of Suez :
¯

Gulf of Aqaba :
¯

General distribution:
Red Sea , Indo-West Pacific: East Africa east to Hawaiian and
Marquesas islands .

Gulf of Suez :
¯
Gulf of Aqaba: Israel (Hibino et al . 2015).

Red Sea main basin:
¯
General distribution: Gulf of Aqaba endemic.

Gulf of Suez :
¯

Gulf of Aqaba :
¯

Red Sea main basin: Egypt ( Goren & Spanier 1985 ), Sudan (
Bamber 1915, as
Muraenichthys schultzii
), Eritrea (
Gallotti 1973, as
Muraenichthys schultzii
).
General distribution: Red Sea, Indo-West Pacific: East Africa east to Johnston Atoll and Tuamotu Archipelago.

Gulf of Suez :
¯

Gulf of Aqaba :
¯

Red Sea main basin: Egypt (
Klunzinger 1871, as
Ophichthys colubrinus
).
General distribution: Red Sea, Indo-West Pacific: East Africa east to Johnston Atoll and Tuamotu Archipelago (but not Hawaiian Islands).

Gulf of Suez :
¯
Gulf of Aqaba: Egypt ( Lieske & Myers 2010 ), Jordan ( Khalaf & Disi 1997 ).

Red Sea main basin: Egypt (
Klunzinger 1871, as
Ophichthys maculosus
), Saudi Arabia (Rüppell 1830, as
Muraena tigrina
; Tortonese 1983 ), Yemen (Picaglia 1894, as
Gymnomuraena tigrina
).
General distribution: Red Sea, Indo-Pacific: East Africa east to Panama (except for Hawaiian Islands).

Gulf of Suez :
Egypt ( Dor 1970 , as
Myrophis uropterus
; Golani 1999).

Gulf of Aqaba: Egypt (
Dor 1970, as
Myrophis uropterus
).

Red Sea main basin: Egypt (
Dor 1970, as
Myrophis uropterus
).

General distribution:
Red Sea , Indo-West Pacific: East Africa east to Marshall and
Marquesas Islands .

bibRefCitation.author: Bamber, R. C.
bibRefCitation.refString: Bamber, R. C. (1915) Reports on the marine biology of the Sudanese Red Sea, from collections made by Cyril Crossland, M. A., D. Sc., F. L. S. XXII. The Fishes. The Journal of the Linnean Society of London, Zoology, 31 (210), 477 - 485, pl. 46.

General distribution: Red Sea, Indo-West Pacific: East Africa east to Line Islands and Pitcairn Group.
Scolecenchelys iredalei (Whitley 1987)

Gulf of Suez :
Egypt (Hibino & Kimura 2015).

Muraenichthys erythraeensis
), Israel (
Bauchot & Maugé 1980, as
Muraenichthys erythraeensis
).

¯
General distribution: Red Sea, Indo-West Pacific: East Africa east to southern Japan , Fiji and Tonga .

Egypt ( Bauchot & Maugé 1980 )
Gulf of Aqaba: Egypt ( Bauchot & Maugé 1980 ), Israel ( Bauchot & Maugé 1980 ).
Red Sea main basin: Egypt (Hibino & Kimura 2015).
General distribution: Red Sea, Indo-West Pacific: East Africa east to Mariana Islands and Pitcairn Group.

¯

¯

Red Sea main basin:
Sudan (
Castle & McCosker 1999, as
Skythrenchelys lentiginosa
).
General distribution: Red Sea, western Pacific: eastern Indonesia and Philippines to Samoa .

Remark.
Skythrenchelys lentiginosa Castle & McCosker 1999
is a junior synonym of
S. macrostomus (Bleeker 1864)
(see
Hibino et al . 2013
).
* Suculentophichthys nasus Fricke, Golani & Appelbaum-Golani 2015
